Event: A plan is conceived by Atlantic Wind Power Corporation
Citation: Snow, M., Snow, R. (2018, February 13). The Ascent of Wind Power in Nova Scotia: Pubnico Point Wind Farm. Retrieved from https://www.iaras.org/iaras/home/caijres/the-ascent-of-wind-power-in-nova-scotia-pubnico-point-wind-farm

Event: Creststreet Asset Management Limited announced their initial offering, it includes raising up to $40 million of investments in both Mount Copper and Pubnico Point.
Citation: Creststreet launches Canada's first Windpower flow-through fund. (2003, November 14). Canada Newswire. Retrieved from https://search-proquest-com.proxy.library.carleton.ca/canadiannews/docview/453333872/BB2C3D2D856A4AD9PQ/62?accountid=9894

Event: Grand opening of the wind farm.
Citation: Wind Energy: Nova Scotia's First Wind Farm Opens (2005, May 26). Canada Newswire. Retrieved from https://search-proquest-com.proxy.library.carleton.ca/canadiannews/docview/453249064/F2D31CF78F9A43EBPQ/15?accountid=9894

Event: The Federal government announces that it plans to invest at least $920 million into the use of wind power over the next 15 years.
Citation: Wind Energy: Nova Scotia's First Wind Farm Opens (2005, May 26). Canada Newswire. Retrieved from https://search-proquest-com.proxy.library.carleton.ca/canadiannews/docview/453249064/F2D31CF78F9A43EBPQ/15?accountid=9894

Event: The Pubnico Point Wind Farm project was purchased by NextEra Energy Canada.
Citation: Allen, C. (2019, March 16). West Pubnico wind turbine destroyed by fire. Retrieved from https://www.saltwire.com/news/local/west-pubnico-wind-turbine-destroyed-by-fire-292653/?location=nova-scotia

Event: A turbine caught fire, burning everything possible in the nacelle. The top of the tower, and the blades were also destroyed.
Citation: Allen, C. (2019, March 16). West Pubnico wind turbine destroyed by fire. Retrieved from https://www.saltwire.com/news/local/west-pubnico-wind-turbine-destroyed-by-fire-292653/?location=nova-scotia
